author: Taylar Ansures
title: Mt. Ashland Ski Area opening day exactly 60 years after first opened
text:
MT ASHLAND SKI AREA, Ore. – Skiers and boarders across the region took advantage of the snow to enjoy Mt Ashland’s opening day Thursday.
There wasn’t enough snow to open during Christmas Break, but this year’s opening day was still extra special as Thursday marks exactly 60 years since the Ski Area first opened.
Mt Ashland general manager Andrew Gast says it’s amazing to be able to celebrate their anniversary exactly to the day.
“A week and a half ago we had dirt on the ground and now we got feet and feet of snow,” Gast said. “I think that 60 years ago when people first came up with the idea of Mt. Ashland, I don’t know that they saw that the pass what it would become and how popular we are. Opening day we filled the parking lot on a Thursday at 9:30 in the morning.”
Gast says there’s still plenty of time to hit the slopes before the season wraps up in early spring.
He says there will be fun events and live music every Saturday until it closes.
You can find more information about Mt. Ashland Ski Area and its season
on their website here.

author: @lacapital
title: Amsafé reclama el llamado a paritarias: Estamos cobrando salarios de miseria
text: Los docentes nucleados en Amsafé reclamaron al gobierno provincial un urgente llamado a paritarias para "comenzar a discutir en serio" la nueva política salarial que permita actualizar los ingresos. Para el gremio que nuclea a los maestros públicos de la provincia, el salario que cobra un docente que recién se inicia está más cerca de la línea de indigencia y es por eso que consideraron necesario una política salarial acorde a los números que marca la economía real de los trabajadores.

author: admin
title: Cancer and African Americans
text:
National-According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), cancer is a term used for diseases in which abnormal cells divide without control and can take over other tissues. Cancer cells can spread to other parts of the body through the blood and lymph systems. Cancer is not just one disease, but many diseases.
A person can lower their risk of getting many common kinds of cancer by making healthy choices, keeping a healthy weight, avoiding tobacco, limiting alcohol intake, and protecting their skin. Screening tests can find some cancers early when treatment works best. Vaccines (shots) can help prevent or reduce your cancer risk (example: HPV, hepatitis).
How Does Cancer Affect African American Populations?
Black/African Americans have the highest mortality rate of any racial and ethnic group for all cancers combined and for most major cancers. Death rates for all major causes of death are higher for Black/African Americans than for non-Hispanic whites, contributing in part to a lower life expectancy for both Black/African American men and women.
From 2015-2019, African American men were 1.2 times and 1.7 times, respectively, more likely to have new cases of colon and prostate cancer, as compared to non-Hispanic white men.
Black/African American men are 1.8 times as likely to have stomach cancer, as compared to non-Hispanic white men and 2.5 times more likely to die from stomach cancer.
Black/African American men have lower 5-year cancer survival rates for most cancer sites, as compared to non-Hispanic white men.
Black/African American men are twice as likely to die from prostate cancer, as compared to non-Hispanic white men.
From 2015-2019, Black/African American women were just as likely to have been diagnosed with breast cancer; however, they were almost 40 percent more likely to die from breast cancer, as compared to non-Hispanic white women.
Black/African American women are twice as likely to be diagnosed with stomach cancer, and they are 2.3 times more likely to die from stomach cancer, as compared to non-Hispanic white women.

author: @newspaper
title: സെബി അധ്യക്ഷ ഹാജരാകാത്തതിനെതിരേ കോൺഗ്രസ്
text: ന്യൂഡൽഹി: ഹിൻഡെൻബർഗ് ആരോപണവുമായി ബന്ധപ്പെട്ട ചോദ്യംചെയ്യലിനായി പാർലമെന്റ് പബ്ലിക് അക്കൗണ്ട്സ് കമ്മിറ്റിക്കു(പി.എ.സി.)മുന്നിൽ ഹാജരാകാത്ത സെബി ചെയർപേഴ്സൺ മാധബി പുരി ബുച്ചിനെതിരേ രൂക്ഷവിമർശനവുമായി കോൺഗ്രസ്. എന്തുകൊണ്ടാണ് ചോദ്യങ്ങളെ നേരിടാൻ മാധബി ഭയക്കുന്നതെന്നും കമ്മിറ്റിക്കുമുന്നിൽ ഹാജരാകുന്നതിൽനിന്ന് ആരാണ് അവരെ സംരക്ഷിക്കുന്നതെന്നും കോൺഗ്രസ് നേതാവ് രാഹുൽ ഗാന്ധി എക്സിലൂടെ ചോദിച്ചു. തങ്ങളുടെ ദുഷ്ചെയ്തികൾ മറയ്ക്കാനുള്ള കവചമായി സെബി ചെയർപേഴ്സണെ കേന്ദ്രസർക്കാർ ഉപയോഗിക്കുകയാണെന്ന് കോൺഗ്രസ് അധ്യക്ഷൻ മല്ലികാർജുൻ ഖാർഗെ ആരോപിച്ചു. അന്വേഷണവുമായി ബന്ധപ്പെട്ട് ഏത് സർക്കാർ ഉദ്യോഗസ്ഥനെയും വിളിച്ചുവരുത്താനുള്ള ഭരണഘടനാപരമായ അധികാരം പി.എ.സി.ക്കുണ്ടെന്ന് ഖാർഗെ പറഞ്ഞു. വ്യാഴാഴ്ചയാണ് പി.എ.സി.ക്കുമുന്നിൽ മാധബി ഹാജരാകേണ്ടിയിരുന്നത്. Share this Article Related Topics RELATED STORIES വാര്ത്തകളോടു പ്രതികരിക്കുന്നവര് അശ്ലീലവും അസഭ്യവും നിയമവിരുദ്ധവും അപകീര്ത്തികരവും സ്പര്ധ വളര്ത്തുന്നതുമായ പരാമര്ശങ്ങള് ഒഴിവാക്കുക. വ്യക്തിപരമായ അധിക്ഷേപങ്ങള് പാടില്ല. ഇത്തരം അഭിപ്രായങ്ങള് സൈബര് നിയമപ്രകാരം ശിക്ഷാര്ഹമാണ്. വായനക്കാരുടെ അഭിപ്രായങ്ങള് വായനക്കാരുടേതു മാത്രമാണ്, മാതൃഭൂമിയുടേതല്ല. ദയവായി മലയാളത്തിലോ ഇംഗ്ലീഷിലോ മാത്രം അഭിപ്രായം എഴുതുക. മംഗ്ലീഷ് ഒഴിവാക്കുക..

author: NewsBreak Original
title: New Richmond mural honors Medal of Honor recipients
text:
By Cameron Thompson, WTVR CBS 6 Web Staff ,
4 hours ago RICHMOND, Va. -- A tribute to the past being brought to life in a mural near West Main and South Granby streets in Richmond that will feature Richmonders who've earned the Medal of Honor.
"Let's share those infallible values of those actions with a city," Ian Berry, the president and founder of Monumental Honor, said. "We want to honor their legacy, uniting the city and developing the future through the process."
Berry said the idea for the nonprofit began when he was at West Point and learned the story of one man: Lt. Jimmie Monteith, who died helping get soldiers off the beaches of Normandy during D-Day.
"Still gives me chills now," Berry said. "He's a Virginia Tech grad, and actually a grad of Thomas Jefferson High School."
Berry said he does not want Monteith's story forgotten or those of the at least nine others from Richmond, including George L. Street, Ernest Dervishian and Powhatan Beaty who will also be featured on the mural.
"And developing future generations through STEM innovation and projects and internships along the way," Berry said.
The mural, which will also include city landmarks, is being installed by renowned-Richmond artist Hamilton Glass.
"It's a chance to have a home to really display and amplify their voices," said Glass, who completed more than 300 murals around the city. "It's my belief that public art is kind of like the thermometer of a community. And kind of tell the history, what's going on, what we believe. And can really be like this beacon of light for us."
Chris Carlisle, a senior at Benedictine Prep, is shadowing Glass through the CapCity Alpha's Young Achiever's program.
"I've seen his art all around Richmond, so seeing that work, being able to be with him in person is really cool," Carlisle said. "He was someone I looked up to."
David Baumann, who is a chef at the nearby Skybox, is excited to see the finished work.
"Something that's nice giving back to the community, teaching people values of what veterans really are," Baumann said. "I think that's a really positive thing and I'm pretty stoked about that."
Berry said the mural is the just one of several projects the nonprofit hopes to place around the city to honor the recipients of nation's highest award for valor. Scholarships and a memorial walkway are also in the works.
"Where you can see the actions and the focus is on the values of their actions and not on the man because man is fallible, but their actions are not," Berry said.
The mural is expected to be completed by Friday, March 22, which will be in time for the Medal of Honor Day on Monday, March 25.

author: F. Salau
title: Abuja to Host Three-Week Solar Installation Certification Course for Women in Energy Sector
text: In a significant initiative, Power Africa, a U.S. government-led partnership, introduces the Elevate: Women’s Solar Installation Certification Course (WSICC) in Nigeria. This three-week training program aims to equip women with technical and vocational skills, enabling them to contribute to the solar energy sector. The program aligns with Power Africa’s broader goal of doubling electricity access in sub-Saharan Africa. Elevate Initiative: Power Africa Launches Solar Installation Certification Course for Women in Nigeria Power Africa’s Elevate initiative focuses on comprehensive power sector reform in Nigeria, emphasizing strengthened enabling environments and increased private sector investment. The Women’s Solar Installation Certification Course (WSICC) is a key component, providing participants with technical skills and preparing them for the Council for the Regulation of Engineering in Nigeria (COREN) Solar Photovoltaic Installation Certification examination. Empowering Nigerian Women in the Energy Sector: Power Africa’s WSICC Training Program Unveiled The WSICC is tailored to women in the energy sector seeking to transition or advance in solar energy technical fields. Additionally, women outside the energy sector with an interest in entering and assuming technical roles in the renewable energy subsector are encouraged to apply. The program targets a diverse audience, fostering inclusivity and skill development. Abuja to Host Three-Week Solar Installation Certification Course for Women in Energy Sector Applicants for the WSICC must complete a two-segment application process, including an application form and a competency assessment. The training, scheduled for March 4 to March 22, 2024, in Abuja, entails a three-week course from Monday to Friday, providing participants with hands-on technical knowledge and preparing them for industry-specific certifications. Deadline Approaching: Power Africa’s WSICC Offers Women Opportunities in Solar Energy in Nigeria Interested Nigerian women, aged 18 and above, employed or self-employed in the energy sector or aspiring to enter the sector, are encouraged to apply before the deadline on February 19, 2024. The selection process prioritizes timely and successful submission of applications, competency test scores, and a commitment to knowledge transfer within participants’ communities or workplaces. Conclusion: Power Africa’s WSICC not only addresses the gender gap in the energy sector but also aligns with broader goals of sustainable development. The initiative aims to create a skilled workforce, contributing to Power Africa’s vision of increased electricity access and capacity in sub-Saharan Africa. As the application deadline approaches, Nigerian women are encouraged to seize this opportunity for personal and professional growth in the clean energy sector. author: NewsBreak Original
title: 23 Blast: How Did Jerry Baker Die? Real Life Death Explained
text:
By Ritika Singh ,
57 minutes ago
Photo Credit: Ocean Avenue Entertainment 23 Blast is grabbing eyeballs again after 10 years of release. The sports drama depicted the rollercoaster journey of real-life football player Travis Freeman. Apart from the film’s storyline, there is one character that has specifically intrigued viewers. It is none other than Jerry Baker, played by Bram Hoover. Fans wish to know what happened to Jerry Baker and if he died in the movie or real life.
Here is everything you need to know about the character and what happened to him in real life.
Did Jerry Baker die in 23 Blast or real life? Yes, Jerry Baker died in the film and real life as well. He passed away in 2007 at the age of 26.
Jerry Baker is one of the real-life characters depicted in the film. He was Travis Freeman’s childhood best friend who played an important role in shaping Freeman’s journey. The star football player was suffering from depression after he lost his vision when Baker helped him get out of it and became a silver lining in his difficult situation. Travis Freeman has always addressed Baker’s importance in his life. It was Jerry Baker who helped Freeman fight back against the roadblocks and make a smashing comeback in the game.
While Freeman managed to overcome his odds, his friend Jerry Baker met with a tragic ending. The movie 23 Blast also made sure to showcase Jerry Baker’s final picture with the football legend, reflecting the importance of Baker in Freeman’s life.
How did Jerry Baker die in real life? Jerry Baker’s death resulted from complications after a critical roofing accident.
The accident led Baker to make numerous visits to the hospital regarding infections, multiple surgeries, and amputation of his legs. Things became worse when he was paralyzed from the waist down and suffered from severe brain damage. Freeman mentioned Baker’s battle with drugs and alcohol in his Q&A with 15 Minutes With . He further shared how Jerry Baker struggled with this addiction till his death in 2007.
The star football player further mentioned that Baker will be proud of 23 Blast and his powerful role in the movie. The film beautifully depicts the journey of two friends, with destiny planning different fates for them.
So, if you want to know more about Travis Freeman and Jerry Baker’s story, make sure to catch 23 Blast streaming on Netflix and Peacock.
The post 23 Blast: How Did Jerry Baker Die? Real Life Death Explained appeared first on ComingSoon.net - Movie Trailers, TV & Streaming News, and More .

author: Jorge Castillo
title: Source - Jesse Winker, Mets agree to one-year contract - ESPN
text:
Outfielder
Jesse Winker and the New York Mets have agreed on a one-year deal, a source confirmed to ESPN amid multiple reports Thursday.
Winker, 31, will return to the Mets after the club acquired him in a trade from the
Washington Nationals at the deadline last summer. The deal is pending Winkler passing a physical, a source told ESPN.
He signed a minor-league deal with Washington coming off an injury-plagued 2023 campaign with the
Milwaukee Brewers. He thrived with the rebuilding Nationals, hitting 11 home runs with a .257/.374/.419 slash line, which made him an attractive trade candidate for contending teams seeking a left-handed bat.
The Mets acquired him for right-hander Tyler Stuart, and he batted .243 with three home runs and a .683 OPS in 44 games with New York.
With
Juan Soto and Brandon Nimmo slated to start in the corner outfield spots, Winker figures to spend most of his time as the designated hitter against right-handed pitchers in 2025 with Starling Marte, as it stands, getting DH starts against lefties.
The Mets and homegrown star
Pete Alonso, who remains one of the top free agents on the market, still have not been able to come to an agreement despite mutual interest, according to sources. Alonso, a four-time All-Star, was drafted by the Mets in 2016.
